comment: Honestly, really easy and enjoyable course. Very easy project, exams are basically just math, homework is a completion grade. The only somewhat hard thing were the chapter quizzes, but almost all the stuff was in the powerpoints.

As far as I am concerned, he was the worst professor I have ever had. His grading criteria were so poor, he lacked many communication skills, and his teaching style was so weak, he just read through the slides and did not even attempt to explain them properly. Do not take this professor!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: For the love of god don't take this class. He grades stuff so sreiclty.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: His online lecture videos were so difficult to understand, not only because of his super thick accent, but his recording quality was terrible. The audio in the videos were often chopped, which wasn't helpful in addition to his poor handwriting. He only gives you a 24 HOUR window to take quizzes/tests, and doesn't give feedback on them.

He is not bad of a professor. Very willing to help when you attend office hours. The accent when watching the videos makes it a little hard to understand, but if you rewatch the part a few times, it helps. Just make sure to watch the videos and do the homework and you will be fine. Project is not that hard either, don't stress about it.

I had a great experience with Dr. Cetinkaya's online course! In fact, I wish he could teach all of my CS courses. I  appreciated his lecture videos as well as his easy quizzes, homework, and exams. The project at the end of the semester wasn't bad either. 10/10, take this professor!
This professor is awesome! He cares about his students and has a clear vision on what he wants from his students. I would take him again.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Online Savvy

comment: Very clear grading structure 3 exams @ 25% each, quizzes = 10%, HW= 5%, easy 1 question quizzes that mirror the exam pretty closely, has an exam review where he breaks down what type of questions will be on them and then solves each one. Honestly if you put any reasonable amount of effort into this class you will get an A, Great Professor imo

Gives clear examples of questions that will be similar to the test in exam reviews. Good examples during lecture but has a bit of an accent. Very understanding guy and willing to help outside of class.

I would ignore some of the bad reviews. He is hard to understand in the videos but not in person. If you email him he will help you with material. Nothing in this class is hard just read the slides and write everything down. He is a very nice man and good teacher would highly recommend. Very organized.

Coskun wasn't great but wasn't horrible. He seems like a nice guy. Here's what I'd say from having taken the class and gotten an A+ with little effort. The exams are easy in my opinion, the math is basic arithmetic. This semester he changed the graded so 3 exams made up 90% when it's usually75%. Pretty thick Turkish accent, lecture are boring. GGs.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Straightforward with everything that's required of the class, but he does sometimes go off topic which might bother some but it was always stuff adjacent to the material.

Decided to change our tests from 25% to 30% bc a "few" people complained. Didn't ask the class. Just randomly did it. 90% of your grade are tests. Each test gives you an hour. You have to write long math in a textbox. Quiz based on HW. HW answers after quiz is done. No scratch paper or a calculator. Doesn't give tests back. L prof
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He decided to change the tests from 25% to 30% (meaning tests are 90% of your grade) after drop/add without consenting the class on this decision. No scratch paper for lengthy math. Expects you to immediately understand topics at a mastery level. A very doable class if his grade scale didn't make it impossible. Avoid if you can!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Idk where the good reviews come from, but they cannot be real. Extremely hard to understand, he is very knowledgeable on the topics he is speaking about. However, he provides little to no explanations. The tests were extremely hard as well. Try to find another teacher if you can.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Highly recommend this prof. He posts a LOT of recorded lectures for the online class and there aren't that many units so you have to work ahead or you won't finish all the material/homework. If you watch all the lectures and leave yourself a couple days to review his study guides, you'll be okay on tests. Very responsive to emails too.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Graded by few things

comment: Professor has a thick accent and can be difficult to understand at times. HW graded for completion, but quizzes are based off the HW, & the solutions for the HW are not posted until after the quizzes so you won't know if you did it right. You have to watch the lectures and exam reviews and practice homework problems if you want to pass.

The professor has one question quizzes every Friday at a certain time. His lectures are hard to understand. The quizzes and tests, you cannot use a scratch sheet for math, you have to do it all in your head. DO NOT TAKE HIM unless you want to fail.

He's a very nice guy and posts his lectures all online going through each PowerPoint slide by slide along with telling examples to make you understand better. He does, however, have a thick accent so it becomes a little hard to understand at times. He also makes test reviews that resemble the test in many ways. Just study the reviews and homework.

He knows a lot in his field but he lacks communication ability and his teaching methods are by far weaker than a high school teacher, most of his lectures are him reading parts of the slides with no explanations and for every exam, you have to read 200-300 pages long pdf and understand it by yourself, don't take him if you can
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: This class is hard in general especially as online. This professor office hours is by far the most helpful tool to passing this class. He will walk you through each question thoroughly until you understand. Great professor!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Cetinkaya is one of the best CS professors available. He clearly states what will be on the test, grades generously, and provides extra credit throughout the semester. Beyond that, his lectures are amazing and he's extremely talented at teaching. Do yourself a favor and take his class.

Great professor class content was difficult but he told us exactly what would be on tests and gave 9 points of extra credit to our final grade throughout the semester. Homework is graded on completion and he has quizzes when homework is due on 1 homework question.

He tells you exactly what's on the exams during class, exams are based on homework which is super easy to go over with him during office hours. I am a slow learner so this was a perfect for me. He's super understanding and helpful. No reason besides self-fault if you do bad since everything given to you.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class
